head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: New City Data Center

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: New City Data Center

body.head.byline: By Charles V. Bagli (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: Human Resources Administration signs deal to move its data center from Manhattan to building under construction in Downtown Brooklyn (S)

block.p: The city's Human Resources Administration signed a deal this week to move its data center from Manhattan to a building under construction in Downtown Brooklyn. The agency will join Empire Blue Cross and Blue Shield at 9 Metro Tech Center, set to open in spring 2003. The agency, which was represented by Cushman & Wakefield, signed a lease for 220,000 square feet with the developer, Forest City Ratner Companies. It now occupies space at 111 Eighth Avenue, between 15th and 16th Streets.
